algorithms.name: Subscriber/next(value)
algorithms.html: The next(value) method steps are:

steps.html: If this’s active is false, then return.
If this’s relevant global object is a Window object, and its associated Document is not fully active, then return.

Run this’s next algorithm given value.

Assert: No exception was thrown.

algorithms.name: Subscriber/error(error)
algorithms.html: The error(error) method steps are:

steps.html: If this’s active is false, report the exception error, then return.
If this’s relevant global object is a Window object, and its associated Document is not fully active, then return.
Close this.

Run this’s error algorithm given error.

Assert: No exception was thrown.

algorithms.name: Subscriber/complete()
algorithms.html: The complete() method steps are:

steps.html: If this’s active is false, then return.
If this’s relevant global object is a Window object, and its associated Document is not fully active, then return.
Close this.

Run this’s complete algorithm.

Assert: No exception was thrown.

algorithms.name: Subscriber/addTeardown(teardown)
algorithms.html: The addTeardown(teardown) method steps are:

steps.html: If this’s relevant global object is a Window object, and its associated Document is not fully active, then return.
If this’s active is true, then append teardown to this’s teardown callbacks list.

Otherwise, invoke teardown.

If an exception E was thrown, then report the exception E.

algorithms.name: close a subscription
algorithms.html: To close a subscription given a Subscriber subscriber, and an optional any reason, run these steps:

steps.html: If subscriber’s active is false, then return.
Set subscriber’s active boolean to false.
Signal abort subscriber’s subscription controller with reason, if it is given.
For each teardown of subscriber’s teardown callbacks sorted in reverse insertion order:
If subscriber’s relevant global object is a Window object, and its associated Document is not fully active, then abort these steps.

Invoke teardown.

If an exception E was thrown, then report the exception E.

algorithms.name: Observable/Observable(callback)
algorithms.html: The new Observable(callback) constructor steps are:

steps.html: Set this’s subscribe callback to callback.

algorithms.name: Observable/subscribe(observer, options)
algorithms.html: The subscribe(observer, options) method steps are:

steps.html: Subscribe to this given observer and options.

algorithms.name: default error algorithm
algorithms.html: The default error algorithm is an algorithm that takes an any error, and runs these steps:

steps.html: Report the exception error.

algorithms.name: Observable/convert to an Observable
algorithms.html: To convert to an Observable an any value, run these steps:

steps.html: If Type(value) is not Object, throw a TypeError.
From Observable: If value’s specific type is an Observable, then return value.
From async iterable: Let asyncIteratorMethod be ? GetMethod(value, %Symbol.asyncIterator%).
If asyncIteratorMethod’s is undefined or null, then jump to the step labeled From iterable.
Let nextAlgorithm be the following steps, given a Subscriber subscriber and an Iterator Record iteratorRecord:
If subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal is aborted, then return.
Let nextPromise be a Promise-or-undefined, initially undefined.
Let nextCompletion be IteratorNext(iteratorRecord).
If nextCompletion is a throw completion, then:
Assert: iteratorRecord’s [[Done]] is true.
Set nextPromise to a promise rejected with nextRecord’s [[Value]].
Otherwise, if nextRecord is normal completion, then set nextPromise to a promise resolved with nextRecord’s [[Value]].
If <var>nextPromise</var> was fulfilled with value <var>iteratorResult</var>, then:
If Type(iteratorResult) is not Object, then run subscriber’s error() method with a TypeError and abort these steps.
Let done be IteratorComplete(iteratorResult).
If done is a throw completion, then run subscriber’s error() method with done’s [[Value]] and abort these steps.
If done’s [[Value]] is true, then run subscriber’s complete() and abort these steps.
Run nextAlgorithm.
Return a new Observable whose subscribe callback is an algorithm that takes a Subscriber subscriber and does the following:
If subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal is aborted, then return.
Let iteratorRecordCompletion be GetIterator(value, async).
If iteratorRecordCompletion is a throw completion, then run subscriber’s error() method with iteratorRecordCompletion’s [[Value]] and abort these steps.
Let iteratorRecord be ! iteratorRecordCompletion.
Assert: iteratorRecord is an Iterator Record.
If subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal is aborted, then return.
Add the following abort algorithm to subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal:
Run AsyncIteratorClose(iteratorRecord, NormalCompletion(subscriber’s subscription controller’s abort reason)).
Run nextAlgorithm given subscriber and iteratorRecord.
From iterable: Let iteratorMethod be ? GetMethod(value, %Symbol.iterator%).
Otherwise, return a new Observable whose subscribe callback is an algorithm that takes a Subscriber subscriber and does the following:
If subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal is aborted, then return.
Let iteratorRecordCompletion be GetIterator(value, sync).
If iteratorRecordCompletion is a throw completion, then run subscriber’s error() method, given iteratorRecordCompletion’s [[Value]], and abort these steps.
Let iteratorRecord be ! iteratorRecordCompletion.
If subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal is aborted, then return.
Add the following abort algorithm to subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal:
Run IteratorClose(iteratorRecord, NormalCompletion(UNUSED)).
While true:
Let next be IteratorStepValue(iteratorRecord).
If next is a throw completion, then run subscriber’s error() method, given next’s [[Value]], and break.
Set next to ! to next.
If <var>next</var> is done, then:
Assert: iteratorRecord’s [[Done]] is true.
Run subscriber’s complete().
Return.
Run subscriber’s next() given next.
If subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal is aborted, then break.
From Promise: If IsPromise(value) is true, then:
Return a new Observable whose subscribe callback is an algorithm that takes a Subscriber subscriber and does the following:
React to value:
If <var>value</var> was fulfilled with value <var>v</var>, then:
Run subscriber’s next() method, given v.
Run subscriber’s complete() method.
If value was rejected with reason r, then run subscriber’s error() method, given r.
Throw a TypeError.

algorithms.name: Observable/subscribe to an Observable
algorithms.html: To subscribe to an Observable given an ObserverUnion-or-internal observer observer, and a SubscribeOptions options, run these steps:

steps.html: If this’s relevant global object is a Window object, and its associated Document is not fully active, then return.
Let internal observer be a new internal observer.
Process <var>observer</var> as follows:

If observer is an ObservableSubscriptionCallback
Set internal observer’s next steps to these steps that take an any value:
If observer is a SubscriptionObserver
If observer is an internal observer
Set internal observer to observer.
Set internal observer’s next steps to these steps that take an any value:

Invoke observer with value.

If an exception E was thrown, then report the exception E.
If observer’s next exists, then set internal observer’s next steps to these steps that take an any value:

Invoke observer’s next with value.

If an exception E was thrown, then report the exception E.
If observer’s error exists, then set internal observer’s error steps to these steps that take an any error:

Invoke observer’s error with error.

If an exception E was thrown, then report the exception E.
If observer’s complete exists, then set internal observer’s complete steps to these steps:

Invoke observer’s complete.

If an exception E was thrown, then report the exception E.

steps.case: If observer is an internal observer
steps.html: Set <var>internal observer</var> to <var>observer</var>.
Assert: internal observer’s error steps is either the default error algorithm, or an algorithm that invokes the provided error callback function.

Let subscriber be a new Subscriber, initialized as:

next algorithm

internal observer’s next steps

error algorithm

internal observer’s error steps

complete algorithm

internal observer’s complete steps
If options’s signal exists, then:
If options’s signal is aborted, then close subscriber given options’s signal abort reason.
Otherwise, add the following abort algorithm to options’s signal:
Close subscriber with options’s signal abort reason.

If this’s subscribe callback is a SubscribeCallback, invoke it with subscriber.

If an exception E was thrown, call subscriber’s error() method with E.
Otherwise, run the steps given by this’s subscribe callback, given subscriber.

algorithms.name: Observable/from(value)
algorithms.html: The from(value) method steps are:

steps.html: Return the result of converting value to an Observable. Rethrow any exceptions.

algorithms.name: Observable/takeUntil(value)
algorithms.html: The takeUntil(value) method steps are:

steps.html: Let sourceObservable be this.
Let notifier be the result of converting value to an Observable.
Let observable be a new Observable whose subscribe callback is an algorithm that takes a Subscriber subscriber and does the following:

Let notifierObserver be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps

Run subscriber’s complete() method.

error steps

Run subscriber’s complete() method.
Let options be a new SubscribeOptions whose signal is subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal.
Subscribe to notifier given notifierObserver and options.
If subscriber’s active is false, then return.

Let sourceObserver be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps

Run subscriber’s next() method, given the passed in value.

error steps

Run subscriber’s error() method, given the passed in error.

complete steps

Run subscriber’s complete() method.
Subscribe to sourceObservable given sourceObserver and options.
Return observable.

algorithms.name: Observable/map(mapper)
algorithms.html: The map(mapper) method steps are:

steps.html: Let sourceObservable be this.
Let observable be a new Observable whose subscribe callback is an algorithm that takes a Subscriber subscriber and does the following:
Let idx be an unsigned long long, initially 0.

Let sourceObserver be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps
error steps

Run subscriber’s error() method, given the passed in error.

complete steps

Run subscriber’s complete() method.

Invoke mapper with the passed in value, and idx, and let mappedValue be the returned value.

If an exception E was thrown, then run subscriber’s error() method, given E, and abort these steps.
Increment idx.
Run subscriber’s next() method, given mappedValue.
Let options be a new SubscribeOptions whose signal is subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal.
Subscribe to sourceObservable given sourceObserver and options.
Return observable.

algorithms.name: Observable/filter(predicate)
algorithms.html: The filter(predicate) method steps are:

steps.html: Let sourceObservable be this.
Let observable be a new Observable whose subscribe callback is an algorithm that takes a Subscriber subscriber and does the following:
Let idx be an unsigned long long, initially 0.

Let sourceObserver be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps
error steps

Run subscriber’s error() method, given the passed in error.

complete steps

Run subscriber’s complete() method.

Invoke predicate with the passed in value and idx, and let matches be the returned value.

If an exception E was thrown, then run subscriber’s error() method, given E, and abort these steps.
Set idx to idx + 1.
If matches is true, then run subscriber’s next() method, given value.
Let options be a new SubscribeOptions whose signal is subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal.
Subscribe to sourceObservable given sourceObserver and options.
Return observable.

algorithms.name: Observable/take(amount)
algorithms.html: The take(amount) method steps are:

steps.html: Let sourceObservable be this.
Let observable be a new Observable whose subscribe callback is an algorithm that takes a Subscriber subscriber and does the following:
Let remaining be amount.
If remaining is 0, then run subscriber’s complete() method and abort these steps.

Let sourceObserver be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps
error steps

Run subscriber’s error() method, given the passed in error.

complete steps

Run subscriber’s complete() method.
Run subscriber’s next() method with the passed in value.
Decrement remaining.
If remaining is 0, then run subscriber’s complete() method.
Let options be a new SubscribeOptions whose signal is subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal.
Subscribe to sourceObservable given sourceObserver and options.
Return observable.

algorithms.name: Observable/drop(amount)
algorithms.html: The drop(amount) method steps are:

steps.html: Let sourceObservable be this.
Let observable be a new Observable whose subscribe callback is an algorithm that takes a Subscriber subscriber and does the following:
Let remaining be amount.

Let sourceObserver be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps
error steps

Run subscriber’s error() method, given the passed in error.

complete steps

Run subscriber’s complete() method.
If remaining is > 0, then decrement remaining and abort these steps.
Assert: remaining is 0.
Run subscriber’s next() method with the passed in value.
Let options be a new SubscribeOptions whose signal is subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal.
Subscribe to sourceObservable given sourceObserver and options.
Return observable.

algorithms.name: Observable/flatMap(mapper)
algorithms.html: The flatMap(mapper) method steps are:

steps.html: Let sourceObservable be this.
Let observable be a new Observable whose subscribe callback is an algorithm that takes a Subscriber subscriber and does the following:
Let idx be an unsigned long long, initially 0.
Let outerSubscriptionHasCompleted to a boolean, initially false.
Let queue be a new list of any values, initially empty.
Let activeInnerSubscription be a boolean, initially false.

Let sourceObserver be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps
error steps

Run subscriber’s error() method, given the passed in error.

complete steps
If <var>activeInnerSubscription</var> is true, then:
Append value to queue.
Otherwise:
Set activeInnerSubscription to true.
Run the flatmap process next value steps with value, subscriber, mapper, and references to all of the following: queue, activeInnerSubscription, outerSubscriptionHasCompleted, and idx.
Set outerSubscriptionHasCompleted to true.
If activeInnerSubscription is false and queue is empty, run subscriber’s complete() method.
Let options be a new SubscribeOptions whose signal is subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal.
Subscribe to sourceObservable given sourceObserver and options.
Return observable.

algorithms.name: flatmap process next value steps
algorithms.html: The flatmap process next value steps, given an any value, a Subscriber subscriber, a Mapper mapper, and references to all of the following: a list of any values queue, a boolean activeInnerSubscription, a boolean outerSubscriptionHasCompleted, and an unsigned long long idx:

steps.html:
Let mappedResult be the result of invoking mapper with value and idx.

If an exception E was thrown, then run subscriber’s error() method, given E, and abort these steps.
Set idx to idx + 1.

Let innerObservable be the result of calling from() with mappedResult.

If an exception E was thrown, then run subscriber’s error() method, given E, and abort these steps.

Let innerObserver be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps

Run subscriber’s next() method, given the passed in value.

error steps

Run subscriber’s error() method, given the passed in error.

complete steps
If <var>queue</var> is not empty, then:
Let nextValue be the first item in queue; remove remove this item from queue.
Run flatmap process next value steps given nextValue, subscriber, mapper, and references to queue and activeInnerSubscription.
Otherwise:
Set activeInnerSubscription to false.
If outerSubscriptionHasCompleted is true, run subscriber’s complete() method.
Let innerOptions be a new SubscribeOptions whose signal is subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal.
Subscribe to innerObservable given innerObserver and innerOptions.

algorithms.name: Observable/switchMap(mapper)
algorithms.html: The switchMap(mapper) method steps are:

steps.html: Let sourceObservable be this.
Let observable be a new Observable whose subscribe callback is an algorithm that takes a Subscriber subscriber and does the following:
Let idx be an unsigned long long, initially 0.
Let outerSubscriptionHasCompleted be a boolean, initially false.
Let activeInnerAbortController be an AbortController-or-null, initially null.

Let sourceObserver be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps
error steps

Run subscriber’s error() method, given the passed in error.

complete steps
If activeInnerAbortController is not null, then signal abort activeInnerAbortController.
Set activeInnerAbortController to a new AbortController.
Run the switchmap process next value steps with value, subscriber, mapper, and references to all of the following: activeInnerAbortController, outerSubscriptionHasCompleted, and idx.
Set outerSubscriptionHasCompleted to true.
If activeInnerAbortController is null, run subscriber’s complete() method.
Let options be a new SubscribeOptions whose signal is subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal.
Subscribe to sourceObservable given sourceObserver and options.
Return observable.

algorithms.name: switchmap process next value steps
algorithms.html: The switchmap process next value steps, given an any value, a Subscriber subscriber, a Mapper mapper, and references to all of the following: an AbortController activeInnerAbortController, a boolean outerSubscriptionHasCompleted, and an unsigned long long idx are to run these steps:

steps.html:
Let mappedResult be the result of invoking mapper with value and idx.

If an exception E was thrown, then run subscriber’s error() method, given E, and abort these steps.
Set idx to idx + 1.

Let innerObservable be the result of calling from() with mappedResult.

If an exception E was thrown, then run subscriber’s error() method, given E, and abort these steps.

Let innerObserver be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps

Run subscriber’s next() method, given the passed in value.

error steps

Run subscriber’s error() method, given the passed in error.

complete steps
If outerSubscriptionHasCompleted is true, run subscriber’s complete() method.
Otherwise, set activeInnerAbortController to null.

Let innerOptions be a new SubscribeOptions whose signal is the result of creating a dependent abort signal from the list «activeInnerAbortController’s signal, subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal», using AbortSignal, and the current realm.
Subscribe to innerObservable given innerObserver and innerOptions.

algorithms.name: Observable/inspect(inspectorUnion)
algorithms.html: The inspect(inspectorUnion) method steps are:

steps.html: Let subscribe callback be a VoidFunction-or-null, initially null.
Let next callback be a ObservableSubscriptionCallback-or-null, initially null.
Let error callback be a ObservableSubscriptionCallback-or-null, initially null.
Let complete callback be a VoidFunction-or-null, initially null.
Let abort callback be a ObservableInspectorAbortHandler-or-null, initially null.
Process <var>inspectorUnion</var> as follows:
Set next callback to inspectorUnion.
If subscribe exists in inspectorUnion, then set subscribe callback to it.
If next exists in inspectorUnion, then set next callback to it.
If error exists in inspectorUnion, then set error callback to it.
If complete exists in inspectorUnion, then set complete callback to it.
If abort exists in inspectorUnion, then set abort callback to it.
Let sourceObservable be this.
Let observable be a new Observable whose subscribe callback is an algorithm that takes a Subscriber subscriber and does the following:

If subscribe callback is not null, then invoke it.

If an exception E was thrown, then run subscriber’s error() method, given E, and abort these steps.
If abort callback is not null, then add the following abort algorithm to subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal:

Invoke abort callback with subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal’s abort reason.

If an exception E was thrown, then report the exception E.

Let sourceObserver be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps
error steps
complete steps
If an exception E was thrown, then:
Remove abort callback from subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal.
Run subscriber’s error() method, given E, and abort these steps.
Run subscriber’s next() method with the passed in value.
Remove abort callback from subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal.

If error callback is not null, then invoke error callback given the passed in error.

If an exception E was thrown, then run subscriber’s error() method, given E, and abort these steps.
Run subscriber’s error() method, given the passed in error.
Remove abort callback from subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal.

If complete callback is not null, then invoke complete callback.

If an exception E was thrown, then run subscriber’s error() method, given E, and abort these steps.
Run subscriber’s complete() method.
Let options be a new SubscribeOptions whose signal is subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal.
Subscribe to sourceObservable given sourceObserver and options.
Return observable.

algorithms.name: Observable/catch(callback)
algorithms.html: The catch(callback) method steps are:

steps.html: Let sourceObservable be this.
Let observable be a new Observable whose subscribe callback is an algorithm that takes a Subscriber subscriber and does the following:

Let sourceObserver be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps

Run subscriber’s next() method, given the passed in value.

error steps
complete steps

Run subscriber’s complete() method.

Invoke callback with the passed in error. Let result be the returned value.

If an exception E was thrown, then run subscriber’s error() with E, and abort these steps.

Let innerObservable be the result of calling from() with result.

If an exception E was thrown, then run subscriber’s error() method, given E, and abort these steps.

Let innerObserver be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps

Run subscriber’s next() method, given the passed in value.

error steps

Run subscriber’s error() method, given the passed in error.

complete steps

Run subscriber’s complete() method.
Let innerOptions be a new SubscribeOptions whose signal is subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal.
Subscribe to innerObservable given innerObserver and innerOptions.
Let options be a new SubscribeOptions whose signal is subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal.
Subscribe to sourceObservable given sourceObserver and options.
Return observable.

algorithms.name: Observable/finally(callback)
algorithms.html: The finally(callback) method steps are:

steps.html: TODO: Spec this and use callback.

algorithms.name: Observable/toArray(options)
algorithms.html: The toArray(options) method steps are:

steps.html: Let p a new promise.
If options’s signal is not null:
If options’s signal is aborted, then:
Reject p with options’s signal’s abort reason.
Return p.
Add the following abort algorithm to options’s signal:
Reject p with options’s signal’s abort reason.
Let values be a new list.

Let observer be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps

Append the passed in value to values.

error steps

Reject p with the passed in error.

complete steps

Resolve p with values.
Subscribe to this given observer and options.
Return p.

algorithms.name: Observable/forEach(callback, options)
algorithms.html: The forEach(callback, options) method steps are:

steps.html: Let p a new promise.
Let visitor callback controller be a new AbortController.

Let internal options be a new SubscribeOptions whose signal is the result of creating a dependent abort signal from the list «visitor callback controller’s signal, options’s signal if non-null», using AbortSignal, and the current realm.
If internal options’s signal is aborted, then:
Reject p with internal options’s signal’s abort reason.
Return p.
Add the following abort algorithm to internal options’s signal:
Reject p with internal options’s signal’s abort reason.
Let idx be an unsigned long long, initially 0.

Let observer be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps
error steps

Reject p with the passed in error.

complete steps

Resolve p with undefined.

Invoke callback with the passed in value, and idx.

If an exception E was thrown, then reject p with E, and signal abort visitor callback controller with E.
Increment idx.
Subscribe to this given observer and internal options.
Return p.

algorithms.name: Observable/every(predicate, options)
algorithms.html: The every(predicate, options) method steps are:

steps.html: Let p a new promise.
Let controller be a new AbortController.

Let internal options be a new SubscribeOptions whose signal is the result of creating a dependent abort signal from the list «controller’s signal, options’s signal if non-null», using AbortSignal, and the current realm.
If internal options’s signal is aborted, then:
Reject p with internal options’s signal’s abort reason.
Return p.
Add the following abort algorithm to internal options’s signal:
Reject p with internal options’s signal’s abort reason.
Let idx be an unsigned long long, initially 0.

Let observer be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps
error steps

Reject p with the passed in error.

complete steps

Resolve p with true.

Invoke predicate with the passed in value and idx, and let passed be the returned value.

If an exception E was thrown, then reject p with E, and signal abort controller with E.
Set idx to idx + 1.
If passed is false, then resolve p with false, and signal abort controller.
Subscribe to this given observer and internal options.
Return p.

algorithms.name: Observable/first(options)
algorithms.html: The first(options) method steps are:

steps.html: Let p a new promise.
Let controller be a new AbortController.

Let internal options be a new SubscribeOptions whose signal is the result of creating a dependent abort signal from the list «controller’s signal, options’s signal if non-null», using AbortSignal, and the current realm.
If internal options’s signal is aborted, then:
Reject p with internal options’s signal’s abort reason.
Return p.
Add the following abort algorithm to internal options’s signal:
Reject p with internal options’s signal’s abort reason.

Let internal observer be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps
error steps

Reject p with the passed in error.

complete steps

Reject p with a new RangeError.
Resolve p with the passed in value.
Signal abort controller.
Subscribe to this given internal observer and internal options.
Return p.

algorithms.name: Observable/last(options)
algorithms.html: The last(options) method steps are:

steps.html: Let p a new promise.
If options’s signal is not null:
If options’s signal is aborted, then:
Reject p with options’s signal’s abort reason.
Return p.
Add the following abort algorithm to options’s signal:
Reject p with options’s signal’s abort reason.
Let lastValue be an any-or-null, initially null.
Let hasLastValue be a boolean, initially false.

Let observer be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps
error steps

Reject p with the passed in error.

complete steps
Set hasLastValue to true.
Set lastValue to the passed in value.
If hasLastValue is true, resolve p with lastValue.
Otherwise, reject p with a new RangeError.
Subscribe to this given observer and options.
Return p.

algorithms.name: Observable/find(predicate, options)
algorithms.html: The find(predicate, options) method steps are:

steps.html: Let p a new promise.
Let controller be a new AbortController.

Let internal options be a new SubscribeOptions whose signal is the result of creating a dependent abort signal from the list «controller’s signal, options’s signal if non-null», using AbortSignal, and the current realm.
If internal options’s signal is aborted, then:
Reject p with internal options’s signal’s abort reason.
Return p.
Add the following abort algorithm to internal options’s signal:
Reject p with internal options’s signal’s abort reason.
Let idx be an unsigned long long, initially 0.

Let observer be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps
error steps

Reject p with the passed in error.

complete steps

Resolve p with undefined.

Invoke predicate with the passed in value an idx, and let passed be the returned value.

If an exception E was thrown, then reject p with E, and signal abort controller with E.
Set idx to idx + 1.
If passed is true, then resolve p with value, and signal abort controller.
Subscribe to this given observer and internal options.
Return p.

algorithms.name: Observable/some(predicate, options)
algorithms.html: The some(predicate, options) method steps are:

steps.html: Let p a new promise.
Let controller be a new AbortController.

Let internal options be a new SubscribeOptions whose signal is the result of creating a dependent abort signal from the list «controller’s signal, options’s signal if non-null», using AbortSignal, and the current realm.
If internal options’s signal is aborted, then:
Reject p with internal options’s signal’s abort reason.
Return p.
Add the following abort algorithm to internal options’s signal:
Reject p with internal options’s signal’s abort reason.
Let idx be an unsigned long long, initially 0.

Let observer be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps
error steps

Reject p with the passed in error.

complete steps

Resolve p with false.

Invoke predicate with the passed in value and idx, and let passed be the returned value.

If an exception E was thrown, then reject p with E, and signal abort controller with E.
Set idx to idx + 1.
If passed is true, then resolve p with true, and signal abort controller.
Subscribe to this given observer and internal options.
Return p.

algorithms.name: Observable/reduce(reducer, initialValue, options)
algorithms.html: The reduce(reducer, initialValue, options) method steps are:

steps.html: Let p a new promise.
Let controller be a new AbortController.

Let internal options be a new SubscribeOptions whose signal is the result of creating a dependent abort signal from the list «controller’s signal, options’s signal if non-null», using AbortSignal, and the current realm.
If internal options’s signal is aborted, then:
Reject p with internal options’s signal’s abort reason.
Return p.
Add the following abort algorithm to internal options’s signal:
Reject p with internal options’s signal’s abort reason.
Let idx be an unsigned long long, initially 0.
Let accumulator be initialValue if it is given, and uninitialized otherwise.

Let observer be a new internal observer, initialized as follows:

next steps
error steps

Reject p with the passed in error.

complete steps
If accumulator is uninitialized (meaning no initialValue was passed in), then set accumulator to the passed in value, set idx to idx + 1, and abort these steps.

Invoke reducer with accumulator as accumulator, the passed in value as currentValue, and idx as index. Let result be the returned value.

If an exception E was thrown, then reject p with E, and signal abort controller with E.
Set idx to idx + 1.
Set accumulator to result.

If accumulator is not "unset", then resolve p with accumulator.

Otherwise, reject p with a TypeError.
Subscribe to this given observer and internal options.
Return p.

algorithms.name: EventTarget/when(type, options)
algorithms.html: The when(type, options) method steps are:

steps.html: If this’s relevant global object is a Window object, and its associated Document is not fully active, then return.
Let event target be this.
An algorithm that takes a Subscriber subscriber and runs these steps:
If event target is null, abort these steps.
If subscriber’s subscription controller’s signal is aborted, abort these steps.

Add an event listener with event target and an event listener defined as follows:

The result of creating a new Web IDL EventListener instance representing a reference to a function of one argument of type Event event. This function executes the observable event listener invoke algorithm given subscriber and event.

algorithms.name: observable event listener invoke algorithm
algorithms.html: The observable event listener invoke algorithm takes a Subscriber subscriber and an Event event, and runs these steps:

steps.html: Run subscriber’s next() method with event.
